MRN-6_syn_1:
Indication: Malignant effusion.
Proc: Bedside Talc Pleurodesis.
Access: Existing chest tube.
Action: 4g Talc slurry instilled. Tube clamped. Patient rotated.
Result: Pleurodesis complete.
MRN-6_syn_2:
PROCEDURE: Chemical Pleurodesis via Thoracostomy Tube.
INDICATION: Recurrent malignant pleural effusion.
NARRATIVE: The existing right-sided chest tube was assessed and found to be functional. A slurry containing 4 grams of sterile talc was instilled through the tube. The tube was clamped, and the patient was repositioned to ensure adequate distribution. The tube was then returned to suction.
IMPRESSION: Talc pleurodesis administered.
MRN-6_syn_3:
Code: 32560 (Pleurodesis via chest tube).
Agent: Talc slurry.
Route: Existing tube (no new insertion code).
Setting: Bedside.

MRN-6_syn_5: bedside talc job. right chest tube. pushed the slurry in. clamped it for a while. moved the patient so it spreads. hooked back up to suction. hope it sticks.
MRN-6_syn_6: Bedside talc slurry pleurodesis via existing large-bore chest tube for right malignant pleural effusion. Position changes performed for talc distribution. Tube returned to suction.

MRN-6_syn_8: We performed a pleurodesis procedure at the bedside to prevent fluid from returning. Using the patient's existing chest tube, we injected a mixture of talc. We clamped the tube and helped the patient change positions to coat the inside of the chest. The tube was then unclamped and put back on suction.
MRN-6_syn_9:
Procedure: Chemical sclerotherapy administration.
Route: Indwelling thoracostomy catheter.
Action: Sclerosing agent (talc) was introduced. Patient repositioning facilitated distribution.
Result: Pleural symphysis induction attempted.
